I pledge to fully refund all referral rewards for @variational_io.

I will proactively process these refunds; there is no need for individuals who used my invitation code to submit separate applications or contact me privately.

First, you must verify that you used my affiliate code:

OMNIGUMPBING

This code was customised by the platform upon my approval as an affiliate member.

Earlier invitation codes may not have been this specific code, but they were essentially the same and would automatically convert to OMNIGUMPBING.

âœ… Refund Method: Currently, there is no automated refund system for referral rewards. Should one be implemented in future, I shall process refunds with a single click. Until then, I will manually refund each amount individually.

âœ… Refund Timing: Monthly or bi-monthly once points accumulation begins. Each refund requires manual verification to prevent errors in subsequent payments. Delaying reduces my workload, but regardless of timing, all remaining rewards will be refunded in full before the TGE.

âœ… Refund Threshold: I shall set a threshold, such as 50 U. When your rewards exceed 50 U, I shall refund them routinely. Should the threshold not be reached by the TGE, I shall refund the entire accumulated amount regardless of the sum.

âœ… Following each return, I shall publish detailed records on X to remind everyone to check their balances.

In summary, all referral rewards will be returned to you in full. Should future promotions ariseâ€”such as cash incentivesâ€”I shall also consider airdropping these to comrades who used my invitation code.

Should any queries arise, feel free to comment below. Let us support one another and progress together.

item.title: RT Holoworld AI: Holoworld x FIGHTMANIA DUBAI Holoworld is partnering with FIGHTMANIA DUBAI to shape a new flagship event that brings together combat ...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Holoworld AI
Holoworld x FIGHTMANIA DUBAI

Holoworld is partnering with FIGHTMANIA DUBAI to shape a new flagship event that brings together combat sports, community, and Web3.

Creators @orangie and @SolJakey will headline the core matchup, supported by a live prediction game.

A major highlight will be the surprise appearance of UFC athlete @SongYadongLFG as the mystery guest, joining participants on stage to offer practical coaching and competitive insight.

The program will also feature a set from Kim Sane, the London based DJ known for his underground sound and international performances across Dubai, Miami, Hong Kong, South Africa and more.

Featuring three rounds, a halftime performance, second half reveal, awards, and an afterparty, built to deliver the feel of a high quality fight night.

Holoworld is supporting the creative direction, production, and distribution plan with a coordinated rollout across KOL networks and media partners.

This event marks the start of Holoworldâ€™s expansion into live formats that connect creators, AI driven entertainment, and global audiences.

item.title: Letâ€™s first clarify two critical fact They tested AI agents in two completely different environments: âœ… 1) Historical exploited contracts (SCONE-ben...
item.description:
Letâ€™s first clarify two critical fact
They tested AI agents in two completely different environments:

âœ… 1) Historical exploited contracts (SCONE-bench)
Based on 405 real vulnerable contracts collected from DeFiHackLabs.
This is essentially a dataset of â€œall wrong answersâ€, where vulnerabilities are already known to exist.

In this environment, frontier models were able to reproduce ~$4.6M in simulated exploit revenue:
â€¢ Claude Opus 4.5: $4.5M (Rank #1)
â€¢ GPT-5: $2.1M (Rank #2)
This setup measures the upper bound of exploitation capability, not real-world attacker profitability.

âœ… 2) Newly deployed real-world contracts (zero-day setting)
From the full BNB Chain, they filtered down to 2,849 newly deployed contracts with no known vulnerabilities.

Here, AI agents found only 2 real zero-day bugs, with actual profit of just $3,694.
Importantly, this result came from GPT-5, not Claude, and the API cost was $3,476 â€”
meaning the net profit was only ~$218.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ğŸ§ª 1) Historical Vulnerability Environment (SCONE-bench)

Goal: Measure the maximum possible exploitation power.
Workflow:

Fork historical block height and fully restore on-chain state
Inject vulnerable contract source code + real liquidity & balances
Give the agent a unified goal: profit â‰¥ 0.1 ETH / BNB

AI performs static analysis + state machine + fund-flow analysis
Automatically writes & debugs exploit code (Solidity / Python)

Executes real transactions on a local fork via Foundry

Success = real balance increase only

Convert profit using historical real market price

Best@8 per contract â†’ take the maximum achievable profit

This environment answers:
ğŸ‘‰ â€œIf everything is exploitable, how much money can AI theoretically extract?â€

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
ğŸ§ª 2) Real New Contract Environment (Zero-day Test)
Goal: Measure real-world economic viability of autonomous attacks.
Workflow:
Filter 2,849 real newly deployed BNB Chain contracts
Fork current mainnet state (production-grade)
No vulnerability hints provided
Only Best@1 (one single attempt) allowed

AI independently audits and attempts exploit construction
Same â‰¥0.1 BNB real profit threshold

Convert using current-day market price

Track API cost vs. actual profit

Final conclusion:
ğŸ‘‰ GPT-5 spent $3,476 to find 2 zero-day bugs, earning $3,694
âœ… This is the first proof that autonomous AI exploitation is already economically feasible.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ğŸ’¥ What makes this framework truly dangerous isnâ€™t just â€œfinding bugsâ€
Itâ€™s this:
AI is placed into a high-fidelity financial attack sandbox, equipped with real hacker tools, and evaluated purely by one metric â€”
â€œHow much real money can you extract?â€
This is the first time cyber-attack capability has been turned into a direct economic production function.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
ğŸ§  A deeper, often overlooked angle: Programming-language generalization
All mainstream programming languages share the same underlying computational abstractions:
â€¢ State transitions
â€¢ Memory read/write
â€¢ Resource management (GC or manual)
â€¢ Concurrency & locking
â€¢ Permission boundaries
â€¢ Exception paths & rollback semantics
Smart-contract languages (Solidity / Move / on-chain Rust) only add asset + consensus constraints on top of this universal model â€” they are not fundamentally new paradigms.

This means:
Once a model masters state + boundary + side-effect reasoning in general-purpose languages, it can transfer almost for free to smart contracts.
Which also implies:
ğŸš¨ Companies claiming â€œWeb3-only programming modelsâ€ have extremely weak technical moats.
There is no structural transfer barrier in this domain.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ğŸ¤– Agent Infrastructure: A major missing layer

Todayâ€™s AI agents are already reaching â€” and in some tasks exceeding â€” human-level operational capability.
But in payments and coordination, we are still stuck with human-centric protocols:

â€¢ KYC
â€¢ Human accounts
â€¢ Manual settlement
Agents were simply never the primary design target.

This is precisely why protocols like:
â€¢ x402 (no-KYC, low-friction, programmable payments)
â€¢ ERC-8004 (native agent-to-agent coordination & settlement)

are not â€œnice to haveâ€ â€” they are mandatory infrastructure for a machine-native economy.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ğŸ§­ The real long-term signal of this report:
â€¢ AI attacks are shifting from research demos â†’ industrialized financial systems
â€¢ The same agentic stack is simultaneously becoming the only scalable defense layer
â€¢ And at the same time, payment + coordination protocols for agents will become the next critical infrastructure battlefield
This is not just about â€œAI hacking blockchains anymore.â€
Itâ€™s about Agents becoming autonomous economic actors â€” faster than our infrastructure is ready for.


Anthropic:â€‚New on our Frontier Red Team blog: We tested whether AIs can exploit blockchain smart contracts.

In simulated testing, AI agents found $4.6M in exploits.

The research (with @MATSprogram and the Anthropic Fellows program) also developed a new benchmark: https://red.anthropic.com/2025/smart-contracts/

item.title: In a bear market, itâ€™s actually easier to make small daily profits if you know how to short. Almost all altcoin pump reactions to â€˜good newsâ€™ are u...
item.description:
In a bear market, itâ€™s actually easier to make small daily profits if you know how to short. Almost all altcoin pump reactions to â€˜good newsâ€™ are unsustainable (avoid heavily controlled coins) because there just isnâ€™t enough money left on the table.
When dumb money believes â€˜this time is different,â€™ itâ€™s often a great short opportunity. You only need to hold a short position for one or two hours to capture a 10â€“20% drop, which is enough to cover the monthly rent.

vitalik.eth:â€‚Encrypted messaging, like @signalapp, is critical for preserving our digital privacy. Two important next steps for the space are (i) permissionless account creation and (ii) metadata privacy.

@session_app and @SimpleXChat are two messaging apps pushing these directions forward.

item.title: RT The Block Podcasts: Inside Infinex: Kain Warwick on building a 'superapp' to solve crypto's UX problems In episode 9 of The Big Brain Podcast, @law...
item.description:
RTâ€‚The Block Podcasts
Inside Infinex: Kain Warwick on building a 'superapp' to solve crypto's UX problems

In episode 9 of The Big Brain Podcast, @lawmaster and @NamikMuduroglu were joined by @infinex founder @kaiynne. The trio discuss how crypto's complex user experience remains a roadblock to broader adoption, and how Infinex aims to tackle this by building the first true "superapp."

They also touch on:

-multi-chain routing
-gas abstraction
-fundraising
-â€œCT mafiaâ€ dynamics
-competing with CEX's and major wallets

OUTLINE
00:00 â€“ Introduction
02:51 â€“ Evolution of Infinex Vision
05:30 â€“ Decentralization vs User Experience
08:29 â€“ Infinex in a Multi-Chain Future
12:30 â€“ User Experience in Super Apps
15:10 â€“ How Infinex Works Behind Scenes
19:25 â€“ Funding Challenges for Super Apps
27:44 â€“ Social Mediaâ€™s Impact on Founders
31:25 â€“ Token Distribution Strategies
34:09 â€“ Token Launch & Listing Challenges
41:28 â€“ TGE Strategy Breakdown
44:40 â€“ Token Utility & Revenue Models
51:53 â€“ Competing in a Crowded Market

item.author: TingHuâ™ª

item.title: Over the past few months of building different Agent systems, Iâ€™ve become increasingly aware of a fact thatâ€™s massively underestimated by most peopl...
item.description:
Over the past few months of building different Agent systems, Iâ€™ve become increasingly aware of a fact thatâ€™s massively underestimated by most people: no matter how powerful an LLM becomes, it simply cannot reliably understand the real state of the world. The moment an Agent steps into executionâ€”opening accounts, placing trades, accessing websites, submitting formsâ€”it becomes extremely fragile. Because it has no â€œreality layer.â€ And this missing layer is exactly what we need an Agent Oracle for. ğŸ¤¯

Why arenâ€™t LLMs enough? Because an LLM is optimized to generate the most likely text, not to determine whatâ€™s true. It cannot verify whether news is fake, detect phishing sites, judge if an API is polluted, understand whether a regulation is actually in effect, or correctly interpret Powellâ€™s real stance. These tasks require verification, not prediction. LLMs can assist in reasoning, but they cannot anchor truth. âš ï¸

Traditional oracles donâ€™t help here either. Theyâ€™re excellent at price truthâ€”ETH/USD, BTC/BNB, FX, indexes, on-chain TVL. But Agents operate in a completely different landscape: unstructured events, conflicting sources, semantic ambiguity, fast-changing signals, uncertainty. This is event truth, and event truth â‰  price truth. The mechanism needed is entirely different.

Thatâ€™s why @soraoracleâ€™s approach stands out. By treating an Oracle as an event verification market, Sora makes truth not something nodes â€œvote on,â€ but something Agents earn through real work. A query goes through TLS/Hash/IPFS capture, MAD outlier filtering, LLM semantic checks, multi-Agent weighted aggregation, reputation updates, and challenge/penalty. The key insight here: Earn = Reputation. Agents donâ€™t gain influence by staking or self-claiming but through long-term verifiable work. This is a big shift. But Sora still isnâ€™t open enoughâ€”because real-world event expertise spans finance, law, medicine, multilingual checks, security audits, scam detection, on-chain monitoring, and domain-specific knowledge. No single team can build all of these Agents. ğŸ”

What we actually need is an open, multi-Agent truth competition market. Humans never rely on a single expertâ€”we compare multiple sources, ask different friends, cross-check KOLs, and let understanding converge through conflict. Agents need to work the same way. ğŸ¤

This is why weâ€™re moving toward ERC8004 + x402.
ERC8004 provides the programmable reputation layer, recording performance history, success rate, call frequency, challenge records, specialization, and stabilityâ€”forming a verifiable career that determines an Agentâ€™s eligibility for truth generation.

x402 provides the payment layer, letting us summon multiple high-reputation Agents in parallel for a single query: independent validation â†’ cross-checking â†’ weighted consensus. Not â€œask one expert,â€ but assemble a committee. This is the truth committee of the machine world. âš™ï¸ğŸ¤–

An open, reputation-weighted, incentive-driven, continuously evolving Agent truth market is likely what future Oracles look like. ğŸ”®

Meanwhile, @0xIntuition focuses on the semantic truth layer. Not every truth can be derived from events. Questions like â€œIs this project trustworthy?â€, â€œIs this governance high quality?â€, â€œDoes the community genuinely like this product?â€, â€œIs this developer reliable?â€, â€œIs this view widely accepted?â€â€”these arenâ€™t binary.
They belong to social semantic consensus. $TRUST uses atom-predicate-object triples and allows users to stake for or against claims, letting consensus accumulate economically. It fits long-term reputation, preference, risk, and classification. Though the current UX is painfulâ€”you canâ€™t even create a simple claim like â€œVitalik is the founder of Ethereumâ€ without having every word registered as an identityâ€”the underlying need is absolutely real. ğŸ’¡

These two layers donâ€™t competeâ€”they complement each other.
Event truth (Agent Oracle) + Semantic truth (TRUST) together form the truth base for AI.

This leads to a clear Reality Stack:
Event truth (Sora / ERC8004 + x402)
Semantic truth (TRUST)
Settlement (blockchains)
This stack may become the actual foundation of AI Ã— Web3. ğŸŒ

Why does this matter? Because todayâ€™s Agents canâ€™t reliably verify, identify sources, avoid scams, resist poisoned data, handle high-risk actions, or cross-check like humans. Without an Agent Oracle, the Agent economy simply canâ€™t exist. With one, we finally give AI a verifiable reality layer. Agent Oracle = the reality layer for AI.
The future Oracle network wonâ€™t be a bunch of nodes, but thousands of specialized Agentsâ€”earning through credibility, collaborating automatically, challenging each other, expanding across domains, and evolving continuously. A real machine truth market. ğŸ¤–âš¡ï¸

Blockchains gave us trustless ledgers.
But the Agent era needs trustless realityâ€”trustless events, trustless semantics, trustless judgments, trustless execution.
Without Agent Oracles, AI cannot act safely in the real world. With them, we buildâ€”for the first timeâ€”a verifiable reality layer for machines.
The future belongs to the protocols that help machines understand the real world. ğŸš€

We think a â€œdovish holdâ€ is easier to pull off than a â€œhawkish cutâ€. Powell could note that we are likely to get a lot of data between the December and January meetings â€“ three payrolls prints, two unemployment rate readings and two CPI reports â€“ and the Fed stands ready to cut again in January if needed.

We doubt Powell can pull off a â€œhawkish cutâ€, i.e., cut but leaning strongly toward a hold in January. Markets wouldnâ€™t find this message credible given the volume of data due out in the intermeeting period


Neil Sethi:â€‚BoA agrees with JPM on a likely Dec #FOMC pause (but I have to say if this is how Powell is thinking, it makes Williams' Friday speech look very odd and makes a hold harder to pull off):

item.description:
RTâ€‚CBB
We might deposit, but I'm not super excited.

MegaETH said 2.5% of tokens are for the entire farming campaign (not just this pre-deposit).

Bread also mentioned that it could be less than 2.5% for pre-TGE farming iirc.

If they allocate 0.5% of total supply to this pre-deposit vault, at current pre-market price, it's around 56% APR assuming TGE in 45 days.

item.title: Iâ€™ve been thinking about one question lately: If the future isnâ€™t built around apps but around thousands of autonomous Agents,how should value flow ...
item.description:
Iâ€™ve been thinking about one question lately:

If the future isnâ€™t built around apps but around thousands of autonomous Agents,how should value flow between them?

Agents wonâ€™t rely on API keys, subscriptions, or Web2 accounts.
They need a payment primitive that feels as natural as calling a function.

Viewed from this lens, x402 feels less like a â€œpayment toolâ€ and more like the Minimum Viable Payment Primitive for the Agent economy.

And when paired with ERC8004, you start to see a real Agent â†’ Agent economic layer forming.

So instead of waiting for that future, we decided to build something for itâ€”now.

After three days of building, weâ€™re launching our first x402 product:

ã€Œ X Spaces Transcription Agentã€
https://x402spaces.up.railway.app

- Pay 1 USDC via x402 â†’ transcribe any Twitter Space.
- Full audio â†’ Whisper (chunked + parallel).
- Raw text â†’ multi-chunk LLM formatting.

The full transcript becomes publicly available for everyone.

Then use 0.1 USDC for: summary, key points, project extraction, translation, etc.

Weâ€™ve already transcribed a number of @daydreams and x402-related Spacesâ€”you can browse, search, and chat with them.

Why start here?

Because high-quality discussions are trapped in audio:
not searchable, not quotable, not analyzable.

Turning a Space into structured data makes it a public asset that Agents can repeatedly consume and compute on.

This is x402â€™s superpower:
One payment â†’ build a data asset â†’ infinite downstream consumption.
And this is only the beginning.

Weâ€™re not â€œbuilding a transcription tool.â€
Weâ€™re building the service layer that future Agents will rely on.

More x402 servers with real-world utility are coming.
x402 + ERC8004 should become the execution substrate of the Agent economyâ€”and we want to help build that foundation.

Bear markets arenâ€™t for resting.
Theyâ€™re for placing bets on the future.

Our bet is clear: x402 + ERC8004 + Agents.

If youâ€™re curious about the technical side,weâ€™ve published a deep dive on Whisper chunking, LLM formatting, and the payment/cache/retry pipeline behind the system.

Huge thanks to @coinbase @kleffew94 @CoinbaseDev @programmer @lordOfAFew
for pushing x402 forward and pouring so much effort into building such a powerful protocol.

Weâ€™re excited to build on top of the foundation youâ€™ve created.

item.title: RT ZEROBASE: To address a temporary shortage of ZBT (ERC-20) on Binance and support user withdrawals, we are cooperating with Binance at their request...
item.description:
RTâ€‚ZEROBASE
To address a temporary shortage of ZBT (ERC-20) on Binance and support user withdrawals, we are cooperating with Binance at their request to manually bridge liquidity.

To ensure smooth withdrawals for all users, ZEROBASE is coordinating directly with Binance to rotate liquidity between networks.

This operation is being conducted specifically to meet user demand on Ethereum.

Thank you for your support!

RTâ€‚Pendle
HYPEUSD on @HyperliquidX tends to be long-biased, with an average of 23.4% APR funding rate since the beginning of 2025.

Hyperliquid whales have been taking advantage of this by running delta-neutral strategies.

With YU-HYPEUSD-Hyperliquid now live on @boros_fi, that means you could potentially gain leveraged exposure to this funding rate payout at a fraction of the cost ğŸ‘‡ğŸ»


Boros:â€‚While spot $HYPE holders are up 50% in 2025, an equivalent long YU-HYPEUSDT position would have you up 600% (or 7x) ğŸ¤¯

That's a 12x outperformance even against one of this cycle's most bullish assets.

How is this the case?

Let's break down some of these dynamics ğŸ‘‡
